_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four fuels that maintain sentient be: Solid food, whether coarse or fine
The causal chain of desire, relishing, a: Desire, relishing, and craving for solid food
Rebirth into a new state of existence in the future
Rebirth, old age, and death in the future
The repetition of the causal chain of de: Desire, relishing, and craving for contact as fuel
Desire, relishing, and craving for mental intention as fuel
Desire, relishing, and craving for consciousness as fuel
The causal chain of no desire, relishing: No desire, relishing, and craving for solid food
Consciousness does not become established there and doesnâ€™t grow
Name and form are not conceived
No rebirth into a new state of existence in the future
No rebirth, old age, and death in the future
The repetition of the causal chain of no: No desire, relishing, and craving for contact as fuel
No desire, relishing, and craving for mental intention as fuel
No desire, relishing, and craving for consciousness as fuel
